018package org.opengis.filter;
019
020import java.util.List;
021import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
022import org.opengis.annotation.Classifier;
023import org.opengis.annotation.Stereotype;
024
025import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.MANDATORY;
026import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19143;
027
028
029/**
030 * Combination of one or more conditional expressions.
031 * The logical operator AND evaluates to {@code true} if all the combined expressions evaluate to true.
032 * The operator OR evaluates to {@code true} is any of the combined expressions evaluate to true.
033 * The NOT operator reverses the logical value of an expression.
034 *
035 * <p>The arity is determined the length of the {@linkplain #getOperands() operands} list.
036 * If 1, this operator is an <dfn>unary logic operator</dfn>.
037 * If 2, this operator is a <dfn>binary logic operator</dfn>.
038 * The length may be more than 2 if the AND or OR operation is repeated for all operands.</p>
039 *
040 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
041 * @version 3.1
042 * @since   3.1
043 *
044 * @param  <R>  the type of resources (e.g. {@link org.opengis.feature.Feature}) to filter.
045 */
046@Classifier(Stereotype.ABSTRACT)
047@UML(identifier="LogicalOperator", specification=ISO_19143)
048public interface LogicalOperator<R> extends Filter<R> {
049    /**
050     * Returns the nature of the operator.
051     *
052     * @return the nature of the operator.
053     */
054    @Override
055    @UML(identifier="UnaryLogicOperator.operatorType, BinaryLogicOperator.operatorType", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19143)
056    LogicalOperatorName getOperatorType();
057
058    /**
059     * Returns a view of filter operands as expressions having {@code Boolean} return values.
060     * The expression list shall have the same size as the {@linkplain #getOperands() operands list}.
061     * For each index <var>i</var> valid for the lists, the following relation shall hold:
062     *
063     * {@snippet lang="java" :
064     * R any = ...;
065     * Object  e = expressions.get(i).apply(any);
066     * Boolean f = filters.get(i).test(any);
067     * assert e.equals(f);
068     * }
069     *
070     * @return a view of {@linkplain #getOperands() operands list} as expressions.
071     */
072    @Override
073    default List<Expression<R,?>> getExpressions() {
074        return new FilterExpressions<>(getOperands());
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Returns a list containing all of the child filters of this object.
079     * This list will contain at least one element, and each element will
080     * be an instance of {@code Filter}.
081     *
082     * @return all child filters used as operands.
083     */
084    @UML(identifier="UnaryLogicOperator.operands, BinaryLogicOperator.operands", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19143)
085    List<Filter<R>> getOperands();
086}
